document.docTitle: Laccophilus bergsteni Manuel & Ramahandrison 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of the diving beetle genus Laccophilus Leach, 1815 from Madagascar (Coleoptera, Dytiscidae, Laccophilini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of the diving beetle genus Laccophilus Leach, 1815 from Madagascar (Coleoptera, Dytiscidae, Laccophilini)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Sorbonne Université, Institut de Systématique, Evolution, Biodiversité (UMR 7205), MNHN SU CNRS EPHE UA, Case 05, 7 quai St Bernard, 75005 Paris, France. & michael. manuel @ upmc. fr; http: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0001 - 9728 - 5580

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Madagascar , former province of Antananarivo , Ankaratra massif, ca.
9.5 km NW Manjakatompo
, GPS coordinates S19°20’ E47°15’ , altitude
2,400 m
.

( ♂ ): ” Madagascar . Ex-prov. / Antananarivo . ca. 9.5 km NW / Manjakatompo .

.

Description. See under
Laccophilus leguyaderi
sp. nov.
Laccophilus bergsteni
sp. nov.
is morphologically closely similar to
L. leguyaderi
sp. nov.
, therefore we provide only a differential diagnosis of the species.

Differential diagnosis . This species differs from
L. leguyaderi
sp. nov.
by the following characters:
- body length on average slightly smaller;
- ventral surface of prothorax also on average slightly darker;
- pro- and mesotarsomeres I–III much less broadened, with ventral adhesive setae smaller;
- protarsal and mesotarsal claws a bit shorter;

- median lobe of aedeagus in lateral view ( Fig. 10 ) as in
L. leguyaderi
; in ventral view a bit narrower ( Fig. 17 ). Parameres ( Figs. 25, 26 ) as in
L. leguyaderi
.

Variability. Specimens vary slightly in habitus (length / width ratio) and dorsal colour pattern (intensity of the elytral brown longitudinal markings; degree of fragmentation of the pale interspaces between these dark bands; extension of the pale area between anterior margin of elytra and anterior extremity of dark longitudinal markings). Some specimens have the metacoxal plates largely dark brown to black as in the holotype ( Fig. 6 ) whereas in other specimens the ferrugineous medial area is more extended.

Measurements. Holotype : TL = 4.0 mm, TL without head = 3.7 mm , MW = 2.2 mm , ratio TL/MW = 1.81. Paratypes : TL = 3.65–4.3 mm (4.03±0.15), TL without head = 3.5–4.1 mm (3.81±0.13), MW = 2.0– 2.4 mm (2.24±0.08), TL/MW = 1.75–1.86 (1.80±0.02).

Laccophilus leguyaderi

(holotype); (10, 17)

(holotype); (11, 18)
Laccophilus makay
sp. nov.
(holotype);
Laccophilus alluaudi
, male specimens from (12, 19) Montagne d’Ambre, (13, 14, 20, 21) Isalo massif, and (15, 22) Ibity massif. Scale bar: 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Habitat. This species was collected at an altitude range of
1,240 –2,430 m
. Its ecology is similar to that described above for
L. leguyaderi
. Notably, in the Ankaratra massif, it is present in natural or degraded mountain forests ( Fig. 45 ), as well as above tree line in subalpine grasslands ( Fig. 46 ).
Distribution. So far known from the Ankaratra, Ambohitantely and Anjozorobe-Angavo mountain ranges, in central Madagascar ( Fig. 53 ).
Derivatio nominis. This species is dedicated to Dr. Johannes Bergsten (Department of Zoology, Swedish Museum of Natural History, Stockholm ). The species name is a noun in the genitive singular.
